question.text:
Select the combination that correctly matches both columns (Either structurally, functionally, or based on location).
 
  Column – I   Column – II
(I) Fovea centralis (i) Inner ear
(II) Perilymph (ii) Blindspot
(III) Vitreous humor (iii) Vestibular membrane
(IV) Reissner’s membrane (iv) Gelatinous tissue

options.text: I - i, II - ii, III - iii, IV -iv
I - iv, II - iii, III - ii, IV -i
I - ii, II - i, III - iv, IV -iii
I - iii, II - iv, III - i, IV -ii

solution.text: Fovea centralis is a section in the eye which is rich in cones and placed close to the blind spot. Vitreous humor is the transparent gelatinous tissue filling the eyeball behind the lens. The extracellular fluid located within the inner ear is perilymph found within the scala tympani and scala vestibuli of the cochlea. Reissner's membrane is also called the vestibular membrane that separates scala media or cochlear duct from scala vestibuli.
